title: "On the waning of forms - a corpus-based analysis of losers in language change (Part 2)"
author: "Martin Schweinberger"

```{r uq1, echo=F, fig.cap="", message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, out.width='100%'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://slcladal.github.io/images/isle6.png")
```


This document documents the analysis of the adjective amplifier *very* in New Zealand English. The analysis was performed with the aim of fitting a generalized-linear binomial logistic mixed-effects regression to explain which factors correlate with the use of *very* and to ascertain if 

1. *very* is decreasing across apparent time 

2. if the decrease of *very* is systematic or layered (which would imply that the use of very is stratified along linguistic and social lines) or unsystematic (which would imply that it correlates with few if any linguistic or social variables). 

# Introduction

We will now begin with the analysis. In a first step, the session is prepared by setting options and activating packages.

```{r sprep, message=F, warning=F}
# load packages
library(tidyverse)
library(tidyr)
# set options
options(stringsAsFactors = F)
options(scipen = 999)
options(max.print=10000)
# load data
ampwsc <- read.delim(here::here("data", "wsc_fullclean.txt"), sep = "\t", header = T, skipNul = T)
# inspect data
str(ampwsc)
```

# Extract examples

```{r dp2_03, message=F, warning=F}
exdata <- ampwsc %>%
  dplyr::select(PreContextLong, Token, PostContext, PreContext, Function, File, Speaker) %>%
  mutate(Example = paste(PreContextLong, Token, PostContext, sep = " ")) %>%
  mutate(ExampleClean = str_replace_all(Example, "/[A-Z]{1,3}", "")) %>%
  dplyr::select(ExampleClean, Function, PreContext, File, Speaker) %>%
  dplyr::rename(Example = ExampleClean, File = File, Amplifier = PreContext, Speaker = Speaker)
# extract predicative contexts
examples_predicative <- exdata[exdata$Function == "Predicative",]
examples_predicative <- examples_predicative[order(sample(nrow(examples_predicative), nrow(examples_predicative))),]
# variants
very_predicative <- examples_predicative[examples_predicative$Amplifier == "very",]
pretty_predicative <- examples_predicative[examples_predicative$Amplifier == "pretty",]
so_predicative <- examples_predicative[examples_predicative$Amplifier == "so",]
really_predicative <- examples_predicative[examples_predicative$Amplifier == "really",]
# extract attributive contexts
examples_attributive <- exdata[exdata$Function == "Attributive",]
examples_attributive <- examples_attributive[order(sample(nrow(examples_attributive),nrow(examples_attributive))),]
# variants
very_attributive <- examples_attributive[examples_attributive$Amplifier == "very",]
pretty_attributive <- examples_attributive[examples_attributive$Amplifier == "pretty",]
so_attributive <- examples_attributive[examples_attributive$Amplifier == "so",]
real_attributive <- examples_attributive[examples_attributive$Amplifier == "real",]
head(very_attributive); head(very_predicative)
```

# Visualization

## Figure 0{-}

```{r dp2_07, message=F, warning=F}
ampwsc %>%
  dplyr::select(Age, Function, Amplified) %>%
  dplyr::mutate_if(is.character, factor) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Age, Function) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(Percent = round(mean(Amplified)*100, 2)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(Age, desc(Age)), y = Percent, group = Function, color = Function)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, 30)) +
  labs(x = "Age", y = "Percent of Amplification") +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.position = "top",
        panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank(), 
        axis.line = element_line(colour = "black")) +
  ggsave(file =  here::here("images", "Percent_Amplified_Age.png"), 
         width = 15, height = 10, units = c("cm"),  dpi = 600)
```


```{r dp2_08, message=F, warning=F}
ampwsc %>%
  dplyr::select(Age, Function, Amplified, Variant) %>%
  dplyr::filter(Amplified != "0") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(Variant = dplyr::case_when(Variant == "very" ~ "very",
                                           Variant == "really" ~ "really",
                                           Variant == "so" ~ "so",
                                           Variant == "pretty" ~ "pretty",
                                           TRUE ~ "other")) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Age, Function) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(Amplified = n()) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Age, Function, Variant) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(VariantN = n()) %>%
  dplyr::mutate_if(is.character, factor) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Age, Function, Variant) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(Percent = round(VariantN/Amplified*100, 2)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(Age, desc(Age)), y = Percent, group = Variant, 
             shape = Variant, color = Variant, linetype = Variant)) +
  facet_grid(~Function) +
  geom_line(alpha = .5) +
  geom_point(size = 4) +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0, 100)) +
  labs(x = "Age", y = "Percent of Amplification") +
  guides(color=guide_legend(override.aes=list(fill=NA))) +
  scale_linetype_manual(values=c(5:1),
                        name="Variant",
                        breaks = c("other", "pretty", "really", "so", "very"), 
                        labels = c("other", "pretty", "really", "so", "very")) +
  scale_colour_manual(values=rep("grey20",  5),
                      name="Variant", 
                      breaks=c("other", "pretty", "really", "so", "very"), 
                      labels = c("other", "pretty", "really", "so", "very")) +
  scale_shape_manual(values=c("o",  "p", "r",  "s", "v"),
                      name="Variant", 
                      breaks=c("other", "pretty", "really", "so", "very"), 
                      labels = c("other", "pretty", "really", "so", "very")) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.position = "top",
        panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank(), 
        axis.line = element_line(colour = "black")) +
  ggsave(file =  here::here("images", "Percent_Variant_Age_Function.png"), 
         width = 15, height = 10, units = c("cm"),  dpi = 600)
```

```{r dp2_12, message=F, warning=F}
wordcounts <- read.delim(here::here("data", "wordcount.txt"), sep = "\t", header = T, skipNul = T) %>%
  dplyr::filter(grepl("DPC", File) == T)
p2d <- dplyr::left_join(wordcounts, ampwsc, by = c("File", "Speaker")) %>%
  dplyr::select(File, Speaker, Age, Variant, Wordcount, Function) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(Variant = dplyr::case_when(Variant == "very" ~ "very",
                                           Variant == "really" ~ "really",
                                           Variant == "so" ~ "so",
                                           Variant == "pretty" ~ "pretty",
                                           Variant == "0" ~ "zero",
                                           TRUE ~ "other")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(Function)) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(File, Speaker, Age, Variant, Function) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(Words = unique(Wordcount),
                   VariantN = n()) %>%
  tidyr::spread(Variant, VariantN) %>%
  tidyr::replace_na(list(very = 0,
                    really = 0,
                    so = 0,
                    pretty = 0,
                    other = 0,
                    zero = 0)) %>%
  tidyr::gather(Variant, VariantN, other:zero) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Age, Function, Variant) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(Words = sum(Words),
                   VariantsN = sum(VariantN)) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(Frequency = round(VariantsN/Words*1000, 5))
# inspect 
head(p2d)
```
